item.title: Green light on the west, facing Cheltenham, 26th September
item.description:
Green lights on the west side, facing Cheltenham are flickering badly and will probably fail soon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Street lamp is not working for weeks!, 26th September
item.description:
This light is right at the entrance to the foot path leading across the stream. It makes the area very dark and scary for the kids walking in this area at before dawn or after dusk. A conservative estimate would say it has been weeks since this light was working - my daughter walks this way when dark weekly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenfall Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road edges are failing, causing road to narrow with no run off. Risk of damage to cars., 26th September
item.description:
Ham Hill, Charlton Kings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ham Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Abandoned Signs and Barriers, 26th September
item.description:
There have been some abandoned road work barriers and signs here for several months now (one way street leading to queens retreat). They are obstructing the path and very often end up pushed into the road. Please could these be removed, thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Gloucester Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a concrete bollard in the path which has been hit twice in the last couple of weeks. The bollard is now leaning at a very jaunty angle onto the pavement and the tarmac surrounding it is now lifted and broken representing a Health and Safety trip hazard, 26th September
item.description:
The concrete bollard is located between nos 15 and 17, Wessex Drive, Cheltenham. GL52 5AF
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Wessex Drive, Battledown, Cheltenham

item.title: Red barriers around some old metal stumps blocking pavement formonths, 26th September
item.description:
Montpellier Grove on the left side heading south. Red barriers have been there months for the sake of 2 small stumps of metal easily removed which have been there for over 10 years as we have lived here nearly 11 years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Grove, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
